comment._content: I was born in a house in Mattapoisett in a house with fenses just like that.

comment.author: 77975599@N03
comment._content: Stonington still looked the same in 80 when I was there; the proverbial New England Town.    The Sailing Ship permanently moored there was probably still sailing in 40.  New London’s Navy Yard, several miles down the road, on US 1, was beginning to bring up the economy to the area in 40, with Germany taking most of Europe.  December 7th, 41 was down the road for us.   Electrical, I wasn't to far from you, over the bridge, in E. Wareham.
